body.para: --- Comment #4 from Darin Adler <darin@apple.com> 2010-02-09 22:13:01 PST --- (From update of attachment 48457) This is *so* funny. I have a similar patch on my machine that I started working on earlier today. I chose to emphasize the fact that the create functions are for use with JavaScript constructors by using the name createForJSConstructor rather than just create for them. And I did the work for WebKit's built-in JavaScript engine too, not just for V8. As you should.
You're also using some non-standard formatting here. In the WebKit project we do not put each argument of a function on a separate line, even if there are many of them.
The arguments should be "const String&" rather than "String". And we name things "document", not "doc", in new code at least.
And we don't use PassRefPtr for local variables.
